channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8779] Add mutateRow method support to Thrift2
item.description:
examples py:

TPut put = TPut()
m1 = TMutation(put=put)
TDelete single_delete = TDelete()
m2 = TMutation(singleDelete=single_delete)
row_mu = TRowMutations(row,[m1,m2])
thbase_service.mutateRow(table,row_mu) # atomically on a single row
item.summary: Add mutateRow method support to Thrift2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
ThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java
ThriftUtilities.java
thrift2/hbase.thrift

patch hbase.thrift thrift2-HBASE-8779.patch
patch ThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java thrift-ThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java-HBASE-8779.patch
patch ThriftUtilities.java thrift-ThriftUtilities.java-HBASE-8779.patch

Can you put diff for the files in a single patch ?

You can generate patch at the root of your workspace.

Indentation should be two spaces per tab.

Thanks
patch to:http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hbase/branches/0.94

I do not know much about Thrift. Could anybody in the know have a look?
This is needed in 0.95+ as well, right?

Moved to 0.94.11 for now.

Lars George I moved this under the umbrella issue for Thrift 2.
I did review the patch. mutateRow never returns htable to pool. Also uses the old table.array().
Also I think it will be a better idea to follow thrift 1 for mutation struct. the patch suggest to use : 


struct TMutation {

  1: optional TPut put,

  2: optional TDelete deleteSingle

}

However I suggest the below struct for TMutation which follows thrift 1 implementation more closely and I believe is more convenient and efficient. 


 struct TMutation {

  1: required TColumn column,

  2: optional binary value,

  3: optional bool isDelete = 0,

  4: optional TDeleteType deleteType = 1,

  5: optional TDurability durability,

  6: optional map<binary, binary> attributes

}



struct TRowMutations {

  1: required binary row

  2: required List<Mutation> mutations

}

I actually ended up removing TRowMutations struct all together. 


  /**

   * mutateRow performs multiple mutations atomically on a single row.

  */

  void mutateRow(

    /** table to apply the mutations */

    1: required binary table,



    /** row that the mutations get applied to */

    2: required binary row,

  

    /** list of mutations to apply */

    3: required List<TMutation> mutations

  

  ) throws (1: TIOError io)

I can create a patch for this if this is approved.
So you are saying to define TMutation not as a wrapper for either a Put or Delete, but rather implement it as what Put and Get's are under the hood?

Yes, We could also use a union instead of struct . The code will look like this 


  union TMutation {

    1: optional TPut put,

    2: optional TDelete deleteSingle,

  }



  void mutateRow(

    /** table to apply the mutations */

    1: required binary table,



    /** row that the mutations get applied to */

    2: required binary row,

  

    /** list of mutations to apply */

    3: required list<TMutation> mutations

  

  ) throws (1: TIOError io)

digging in thrift documentation , I think that's what the unions are for.

The reason I suggested to create the TMutation struc the way I did was that it makes mutateRow less error prone. TDelete and TPut both can have multiple columns, and also a required field for row. But the TMutation can not have mutiple columns or a row value.

Understood. I would like to keep this as close to the Java API as possible, and it does the same thing, i.e. it creates the wrapper RowMutation with a specific row and then has a addPut() and addDelete() that checks internally if the two match. So, if there is no other reason, I suggest we go with the latter, the union TMutation approach. Since we use RowMutation in the handler code we will get the same errors as the Java user does.

Makes sense?
It does make sense. I do agree that it is a good idea to keep this close to Java API. What do you think about mutateRow ? should we keep TRowMutations or we can have a mutateRow the way I had it?
If we want to be really close, we should do the TRowMutations and then have mutateRow() accept that like the Java API (plus the table obviously).
alright then I will create a patch with union for TMutation and struc TRowMutations

Hey Hamed Madani, are you sure Unions are supported everywhere? I found a comment in THRIFT-409 that indicates it is Java only for now? Bryan Duxbury, maybe you could help pointing out if Union is good to use?
I'm on Nodejs, and it does work with nodejs. I haven't tested other clients. Uploaded the patch with union for TMutation
Looks great! Thanks for keeping adding to the test too. I have checked on trunk/0.98 and 0.95 and both work fine. If you could kindly take stab at the 0.94 patch?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12592762/HBASE-8779-v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rest.client.TestRemoteAdmin

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6376//console

This message is automatically generated.
Uploaded the patch for 0.94

Tests pass, looking good Hamed. Thanks for the patches!

Committed to all major branches.
